intro: Phacelia arenicola, commonly known as the sand phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It thrives in sandy and gravelly soils, often found in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy inflorescences. Phacelia arenicola plays an important role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
